oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Veterinarians' Potential as Feedlot Managers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Flack, Duane
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: feedlot
manufacturing
management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The operation of a modern feedlot is, without a doubt, an industry. It is not a farming enterprise anymore; it is a manufacturing entity by any description, utilizing raw materials to produce an end product through the efforts of people. Being as close to home as I am, going back to the definition that was given a little earlier of an expert as being more than fifty miles from homeâ€”I am not!
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1971; 225-227
